string-array.name: facts
string-array.item: Signs of heatstroke: Red, hot, and dry skin, Throbbing headache, Rapid heartbeat, Rapid, shallow breathing
Signs of exhaustion: Confusion, Muscle cramps, Nausea, Fatigue
Signs Stroke SUDDEN numbness, weakness of face, arm or leg (esp one side) trouble seeing one/both eyes, severe headache
Heart Attack: pressure in the center of your chest. Pain in one/both arms; cold sweat, nausea or lightheadedness.
US Foreign Aid: $48.4 billion -military = $17.2billion economic assistance: $31.2 billion
What do you get if you mix human DNA with a goat? Banned from the petting zoo.
Why don\'t blind people skydive? It scares the hell out of the dog.
Q. Why are pirates pirates? Because they Arrrrrrrrrrrrrr
Q: How do you catch a squirrel? Climb up a tree and act like a nut.
What did the farmer say when he lost his tractor? Where\'s my tractor?
Idaho's nickname is the "Gem State", because nearly every known type of gemstone has been found there.
Humans may have been present in the Idaho area as long as 14,500 years ago ( Excavations at Wilson Butte Cave near Twin Falls)
creation of the Idaho Territory on July 4, 1863
1843 to 1849 present-day Idaho was under the de facto jurisdiction of the Provisional Government of Oregon; daho Territory on July 4, 1863
Lewis and Clark expedition crossed Idaho in 1805
first attempts at organized communities, within the present borders of Idaho, were established in 1860; state in 1889
Idaho gross state product for 2012 was $58.2 billion
